intro: Sabulina glabra, commonly known as the smooth sandwort, is a low-growing perennial plant native to arctic and alpine regions. It belongs to the family Montiaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and small, clustered leaves. The plant produces tiny white or pale pink flowers that bloom in the summer months. It thrives in well-drained, sandy or rocky soils and is often found in tundra and mountainous habitats. Due to its hardy nature, it is adapted to cold climates and can withstand harsh environmental conditions.
